data.title: Royal Shakespeare Company
data.meta_description: License video footage of Shakespeare productions from our acclaimed 'Live From Stratford-upon-Avon' films
data.text:
Clip licensing

You can license production footage from our acclaimed 'Live from Stratford-upon-Avon' films

Since 2013 we have been filming our onstage Shakespeare productions for worldwide cinema broadcast. Clips of these high-definition films are now available to license for editorial and commercial projects, without the need for additional clearances.

Play video

HOW TO LICENSE VIDEO CLIPS

Where clips have already been cut (as listed below), we are able to provide these within shorter timescales. If bespoke clips are required, we may require longer to facilitate your request. Video clips can be requested as high resolution or web quality and prices start at Â£6 per second, up to a maximum duration of 5 minutes. Discounts are available for bulk orders or for non-commercial educational use.

More information on our clip licensing service can be found in our Clip Licensing Guide.

To request a clip, please download and complete our Digital License Order Form (editable pdf, downloads as zip file)

For queries, please email images@rsc.org.uk

PRODUCTION CLIPS

Launch Gallery

ANTONY AND CLEOPATRA (2017)

Directed by Iqbal Khan.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 3: Cleopatra waits for the arrival of her lover, Antony.

Featuring Josette Simon as Cleopatra and Antony Byrne as Mark Antony.

From line "Where is he?" to "My full heart remains in use with you."

AS YOU LIKE IT (2019)

Directed by Kimberley Sykes

Clip immediately available:

Act 4 scene 1: Rosalind (dressed as Ganymede) tells Orlando to woo her as if she is his love

Featuring Lucy Phelps as Rosalind, David Ajao as Orlando and Sophie Khan Levy as Celia.

From line "But come, woo me" to "I cannot say the words."

CORIOLANUS (2017)

Directed by Angus Jackson.

Clip immediately available:

Act 3 scene 2: Volumnia urges Coriolanus to apologise to the Tribunes.

Featuring Sope Dirisu as Coriolanus and Haydn Gwynne as Volumnia.

From line "Let them pull all about mine ears" to "which else would put you to your fortunes and the hazard of much blood."

CYMBELINE (2016)

Directed by Melly Still.

Clip immediately available:

Act 2 scene 2: Iachimo visits Innogen's (Imogen) bedchamber to steal her bracelet.

Bethan Cullinane as Innogen (Imogen) and Oliver Johnstone as Iachimo.

From line "Who's there? My woman Helen" to "To the maddening of her lord."

HAMLET (2016)

Directed by Simon Godwin.

Clips immediately available:

Act 3 scene 1: Hamlet considers his mortality.

Featuring Paapa Essiedu as Hamlet.

Line from "To be or not to be..." to "and lose the name of action."

Act 3 scene 2: Hamlet confronts Rosencrantz and Guildenstern about their motives for visiting.

Featuring Paapa Essiedu as Hamlet, Hiran Abeysekera as Horatio, James Cooney as Rosencrantz and Bethan Cullinane as Guildenstern.

Line from "Oh good Horatio, I'll take the Ghost's word for a thousand pounds" to "Call me what instrument you like, though you fret me, you cannot play upon me."

HENRY IV PART 1 (2014)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clip immediately available:

Act 2 scene 4: The mock-trail scene at the Boar's Head Tavern.

Featuring Antony Sher as Sir John Falstaff and Alex Hassell as Prince Hal.

From line "Do thou stand upon my father and examine me upon the particulars of my life" to "I do, I will."

HENRY IV PART 2 (2014)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clip immediately available:

Act 3 scene 1: King Henry considers his mortality.

Featuring Jasper Britton as King Henry IV.

From line "How many thousands of my poorest subjects. Are at this hour asleep!" to "Uneasy lies the head that wears a crown."

HENRY V (2015)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 2: Henry V is presented with the French King's gift of tennis balls.

Featuring Alex Hassell as Henry V.

From "You Highness, lately sending into France..." to "Convey him with safe conduct, fare you well."

Act 3 scene 1: Henry's speech to rouse the troops.

Featuring Alex Hassell as Henry V.

From "Once more unto the breach, dear friends, once more" to "Cry 'God for Harry, for England and Saint George!'"

JULIUS CAESAR (2017)

Directed by Angus Jackson.

Clip immediately available:

Act 3 scene 2: Mark Antony addresses the citizens of Rome - 'Friends, Romans, Countrymen' speech.

Featuring James Corrigan as Mark Antony.

From line "For Brutus' sake, I am beholding to you" to "Thou art fled to brutish beasts and men have lost their reason."

KING LEAR (2016)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 1: King Lear divides his kingdom

Featuring Antony Sher as King Lear, Natalie Simpson as Cordelia, Kelly Williams as Regan and Nia Gwynne as Goneril.

From: "Tell me my daughters..." to "So young, my lord, and true."

LOVE'S LABOUR'S LOST (2014)

Directed by Christopher Luscombe.

Clip immediately available:

Act 4 scene 3: The men uncover each other's feelings for the French ladies.

Featuring Sam Alexander as King of Navarre, Tunji Kasim as Dumaine, William Belchambers as Longaville, Edward Bennett as Berowne.

From line: "I heard your guilty rhymes..." to "There is no certain princess that appears?"

MACBETH (2018)

Directed by Polly Findlay.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 7: Lady Macbeth urges Macbeth to kill Duncan.

Featuring Christopher Eccleston as Macbeth and Niamh Cusack as Lady Macbeth.

From line "I have given suck..." to "...false face must hide what the false heart doth know."

THE MERCHANT OF VENICE (2015)

Directed by Polly Findlay.

Act 3 scene 1: Shylock's 'Hath not a Jew eyes?' speech.

Featuring Makram J Khoury as Shylock and Owen Findlay as Salerio.

From line "He hath disgraced me and hindered me half a million..." to "If you wrong us, shall we not revenge?"

THE MERRY WIVES OF WINDSOR (2018)

Directed by Fiona Laird.

Clip immediately available:

Act 2 scene 1: Mistress Ford and Mistress Page discuss Falstaff's letter.

Featuring Beth Cordingly as Mistress Ford and Rebecca Lacey as Mistress Page.

From line "Mistress Page, Meg..." to "Let's consult together against this greasy knight. Come, come."

MUCH ADO ABOUT NOTHING (2014)

Directed by Christopher Luscombe.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 1: Beatrice and Benedick meet.

Featuring Edward Bennett as Benedick and Michelle Terry as Beatrice.

From line "You embrace your charge too willingly; I think this is your daughter?" to "I know you of old."

OTHELLO (2015)

Directed by Iqbal Khan.

Clip immediately available:

Act 3 scene 3: Iago convinces Othello of Desdemona's infidelity.

Featuring Hugh Quarshie as Othello and Lucian Msmati as Iago.

From line: "But I do see you are moved" to "Fear not my government."

RICHARD II (2013)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clip immediately available:

Act 4 scene 1: Richard's deposition.

Featuring David Tennant as Richard II and Nigel Lindsay as Bolingbroke.

From line "Alack, why am I sent for to a king / Before I have shook off the regal thoughts / Wherewith I reign'd?" to "And send him many years of sunshine days."

ROMEO AND JULIET (2018)

Directed by Erica Whyman

Clip immediately available:

Act 2 scene 1 (sometimes scene 2): The balcony scene - Romeo and Juliet meet

Featuring Bally Gill as Romeo and Karen Fishwick as Juliet.

From line "See how she leans her cheek upon her hand?..." to "By whose direction founds't thou out this place?" "By love..."

THE TAMING OF THE SHREW (2019)

Directed by Justin Audibert.

Clip immediately available (up to 5 minutes):

Act 2 scene 1: Petruchia and Katherine meet for the first time.

(This production featured gender role reversal) Featuring Claire Price as Petruchia, Joseph Arkley as Katherine, Laura Elsworthy as Trania, Amanda Harris as Baptista, and Sophie Stanton as Gremia.

From "Sat that he rail..." to "I will be the witness!"

THE TEMPEST (2016)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 2: Prospero summons Ariel and asks about the outcome of the storm.

Featuring Simon Russell Beale as Prospero and Mark Quartley as Ariel.

From line "Come away servant" to "Safely in harbour is the King's shop."

TITUS ANDRONICUS (2017)

Directed by Blanche McIntyre.

Clip immediately available:

Act 1 scene 1: Tamora pleads for her son's life.

Featuring David Troughton as Titus Andronicus and Nia Gwynne as Tamora.

From line: "I give him you, the noblest that survives..." to "let's hew his limbs till they be clean consumed."

TROILUS AND CRESSIDA (2018)

Directed by Gregory Doran.

Clips immediately available:

Act 3 scene 2: Troilus and Cressida vow to be faithful to one another.

Featuring Amber James as Cressida, Gavin Fowler as Troilus and Oliver Ford Davies as Pandarus.

From line "Boldness comes to me now..." to "...and Pandar to provide this gear."

TWELFTH NIGHT (2018)

Directed by Christopher Luscombe.

Clip immediately available (up to 5 minutes):

Act 2 scene 5: Malvolio reads Olivia's letter

Featuring Adrian Edmondson as Malvolio.

From "To be Count Malvolio!" to "This is open."

THE TWO GENTLEMEN OF VERONA (2014)

Directed by Simon Godwin.

Clips immediately available:

Act 2 scene 1: The men discuss Valentine's love for Sylvia.

Featuring Michael Marcus as Valentine and Martin Bassindale as Speed.

From line "Tell me, do you know my lady Sylvia?" to "Now he will interpret to her."

Act 4 scene 2: Turio serenades Sylvia.

Featuring Nicholas Gerard Martin as Turio.

From line "Who is Sylvia? What is she..." to "To her, let us garlands bring" [sung].

PERSONAL USE

You can also buy DVDs of these productions from our online shop.
